```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(tidymodels)
```

## Correlation Plot

```{r}
# i'm not totally sure how we should treat all of these correlated variables, we can
# definitely drop some of them (and I already dropped a couple)
library(corrr)

data %>%
  select(xwOBA, SO, `K %`, `Barrel %`,
         ERA:`xwOBA - wOBA`, ERA:`xBA - BA`,
         ERA:`BABIP - Mean BABIP`, `ERA/Hard Hit %`,
         -`ERA (t+1)`, -`Salary (t+1)`,
         -`ERA/Hard Hit %`) %>%
  correlate() %>%
  rearrange() %>%
  shave() %>%
  rplot(shape = 15, colours = c("darkorange", "white","midnightblue")) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90))

```
